title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria - BBC News
summary: school aims to gather 1.5m buttons to remember holocaust children .
cumbrian residents given chance to comment of £ 72m flood work options .
carlisle people get a chance to comment on plans for 'garden village ' .

documents.title: a day of past and future : bbc cumbria live
text: the news today has looked 70 years into the past and perhaps 30 into the future : here 's a reminder :
we 'll be back to do it again at 08:00 on monday .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a very good weekend .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cloud moving in and milder
text: cloud will build up and winds will increase during the evening and overnight so it will be milder than last night and frost-free .
rain will reach cumbria by morning , with the temperatures falling to 4c ( 39f ) and then rising .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: trust seeks volunteer guides for poet 's house
text: new volunteers are being sought to help out in places such as a bothy at ashness bridge and wordsworth house in cockermouth .
the national trust says the wordsworth house roles could involve house tours , selling raffle tickets and acting as a guide .
more information will be on offer at drop-in events at wordsworth house and keswick 's theatre by the lake next month .
i feel privileged to be a volunteer at such a historic treasure . ''

documents.title: drunken beating punished with 10 year sentence
text: a cleator moor man who battered a friend in a drunken attack that lasted several hours has been jailed for 10 years .
in november , carlisle crown court heard that jordan smith was drinking with neil mclaughlin when he turned on him , beating him with a baseball bat and a bottle , stamping and jumping on him .
smith , 25 , of high street , cleator moor , admitted causing grievous bodily harm in the attack in august last year , and his sentence was adjourned until now for reports .

afterwards det con debi gilmour said it was `` a sustained and vicious attack '' , adding : i hope today 's sentence shows how seriously both the police and the courts take such violent offending . ''

documents.title: one of six of the best makes mark in great langdale
text: this is an art installation called ordnance pavilion , inspired by os maps , nearing completion and being unveiled behind the wainwright 's inn , in great langdale , tomorrow .
it 's one of six installations being erected in the lake district by the arts project lakes ignite .
author: Jennie Dennett
BBC Cumbria

documents.title: zip wire mystery tour protest is booked up
text: a protest rally against controversial plans for two sets of zip wires across thirlmere , which is taking place at an undisclosed location tomorrow , has been booked up .
the conservation group said around 200 people had booked to be collected and taken to the rally where they 'll be addressed by speakers including the film-maker terry abraham .

documents.title: power scheme 'will save money but may not be cheapest '
text: allerdale council says an energy switching scheme it runs has been proven to save people money , despite doubts being raised about whether it offers the best deals on the market .

one local man says despite registering with the big allerdale switch , he 's always been able to find cheaper tariffs elsewhere , and the regulator ofgem has said in the past there 's a risk such schemes will make people think they offer the best available deal .
the council says most people who take part can save money by switching and that people who register are not forced to switch if their existing tariff is cheaper .
a number of local authorities run similar deals .

documents.title: fishing crews asked to observe ban off st bees head
text: fishing crews are being asked to observe a voluntary ban on netting within a kilometre of st bees head during the spring , to help avoid diving birds becoming tangled in their gear and drowning .

the north western inshore fisheries and conservation authority says the headland is an important breeding area for birds such as guillemots and razorbills , which can get tangled when they dive into the sea for food .
the ban will run from 1 march to 15 july , although it may be extended if natural england says nesting is taking place later than usual .
a spokesman said fishers themselves had been deeply upset when they found drowned birds .

documents.title: travel : eden bridge reopened in carlisle
text: police say the incident on eden bridge has been resolved and the a7 has been reopened
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel : eden bridge in carlisle closed
text: the eden bridge in carlisle has been closed while police deal with an incident .
police are asking drivers to avoid the area .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel : road works slow traffic on a65 at crooklands
text: there are queues on the a65 at crooklands because of temporary traffic lights while water mains work takes place .
there are also some delays remaining on the a590 between junction 36 and the brettargh holt junction because of an earlier accident .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : dry and sunny
text: it will stay dry this afternoon throughout the county with significantly lighter winds than recently .
it will feel pleasant in long sunny spells , with a maximum temperature of about 6c ( 43f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your a near-perfect winter day
text: it must be the best day of the week for weather today , and brian moffat was lucky enough to get this view of skiddaw in the sunshine .
our thanks to him for thinking of us .
if you want to share a photo with the county , you can email it to us here .

documents.title: travel : congestion again on a590
text: the temporary traffic lights on the a590 at backbarrow are causing delays between newby bridge and haverthwaite again .

documents.title: carlisle miss out on leeds forward signing
text: we understand leeds united forward mallik wilks will join grimsby today , in spite of interest from carlisle united and chesterfield .
united are still thought to be in for 23-year-old hearts striker cole stockton , having let shaun miller move to crewe on loan .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: fire crews free driver after wigton crash
text: a man was cut from the wreckage of his car after an accident yesterday evening on the a595 at wigton .
the crash involved a ford fiesta , driven by a 62-year-old man from workington , and another vehicle , driven by a 41-year-old from wigton .
the driver who was cut free had minor injuries - the other motorist was not hurt .
correction 29 january 2018 : this report has been updated to amend incorrect information about those involved in the accident .

documents.title: carlisle people urged : look 30 years into future
text: people in carlisle are being offered the chance to comment on plans for a major expansion of the city to the south .
the city council 's planning to allow 10,000 in an area to be called st cuthberts along with all the facilities such a community would need .
access will by along a new southern bypass , which is also being opened up to public consultation .
carlisle city council leader colin glover says it is a big change for local people to influence the growth of the city .
this is really a blank canvas and a wonderful opportunity for people to think forward 25 or 30 years , as to what they think people should be living like at that time . ''

documents.title: new chairman joins morecambe bay nhs trust
text: the nhs trust that runs hospitals in south cumbria and north lancashire is getting a new chairman as well as a new chief executive .
ian johnson will move across from the blackpool hospitals trust , where he 's been in the chair since 2012 ; he is a solicitor with wide experience in the uk and abroad .

earlier this month dame jackie daniel announced she would step down later this year from her job as chief executive of university hospitals of morecambe bay nhs foundation trust , and no replacement has yet been announced .

documents.title: plans for new carlisle suburb go on show
text: plans for up to 10,000 new homes in carlisle 's `` garden village '' go on show to the public today online and in libraries or the civic centre
it will be one of 14 new communities across the country , in a project announced by the government last year to build more housing .
st cuthbert 's would be on the south side of carlisle between junction 42 of the m6 and the a595 .
it would be created along with a a southern bypass , which would take traffic out of the city centre and give access to the new estates .

documents.title: people given a chance to comment on £ 72m flood plans
text: people are being asked what they think about suggestions on spending £ 72m on flood prevention around the county .
a series of 15 drop-in sessions are being held , with the first in carlisle today and others in the catchment areas of the eden , the derwent , and the kent and levens rivers in south cumbria .
andy brown , a flood risk manager with the environment agency , says the options have been developed over the past two years but it 's impoirtant that local people contribute to the discussions
i could come up with a technical analysis that might say a 5m wall through a town would be a really good option but actually that 's unacceptable for the people who live in that place . ''

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : best day of the week
text: the lake district weatherline assessors say there has been fresh snow above 600m ( 1,960ft ) , and full winter clothing and equipment are required on the high fells .

documents.title: a button for every child murdered in the holocaust
text: thousands of buttons from all over the world are arriving at a windermere school after students there set out to collect 1.5 million for a history project .
their school is built on a site that played a small but key part in the recovery of 300 children who survived the nazi holocaust , and every button will represent a child who died .
people from the community will be at the school tomorrow , between 10:00 and 15:00 , to help with counting the buttons , and anyone can go .
author: Alison Wood
Journalist

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : a frosty start , then feeling pleasant
text: after a frosty start in rural inland areas , the whole day will be dry with significantly lighter winds than recently .
it will feel pleasant with long sunny spells and temperatures of 7c ( 46f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: we 've got news this morning , and a bit of extraordinary history , and as always , travel reports , a regular weater forecast , and maybe one or two other nuggets .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 've now handed this news feed over to the software , which will post any important breaking news or travel reports overnight .
here 's a reminder of some of thursday 's developments :
we 'll be back , hopefully with better gags , from 08:00 tomorrow .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: mp : report shows young people get worst mental health deal
text: westmorland and lonsdale mp tim farron says a critical report into a cumbrian health trust today shows urgent help is needed .
care quality commission inspectors said they 'd found little improvement at the cumbria partnership trust since their last report .
lib dem mr farron said it was clear the trust was being starved of resources by the government and called for an emergency funding package .
he said the inspection did n't even include what he thought was the worst area , mental health services for young people .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : scattered showers clearing later
text: scattered and locally heavy showers will continue across cumbria at first this evening , perhaps with some snow over the highest ground of the lakeland fells .
some patchy frost may form by dawn , with lowest temperatures around 0c ( 32f )
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cumbrian schools listed in new tables
text: tables allowing parents and students to compare how schools in the county perform under a number of headings have been published today .

the information is complex : for example , the richard rose academy sixth form tops the table for progress made by a-level students , but but just 7 % achieved aab in key a-level subjects , compared with the county average of 13.5 % , and the rest of the school is classed overall as average .
you can find the table here , and the information you need to explain the secondary school tables here .
it is pleasing to see cumbria 's headline results show an improvement on last year 's results for our young people . ''

documents.title: unions 'shocked ' by paper mill jobs threat
text: unions at the kimberley clark tissue paper factory in barrow say they were shocked by a company announcement of thousands of job losses .
the texas-based firm says it will close ten plants around the world and shed at least 5,000 to try to strengthen the firm 's finances .
carol bundy from the unite union said the message from the firm in recent meetings had been that the barrow plant was running successfully .
there was no indication whatsoever that there would be any announcement of job losses . ''

documents.title: zip wire plan questioned in lords
text: several members of the house of lords have criticised plans for a zip wire across thirlmere during questions to a local government minister .

lord greaves , who said he was a keen rock climber , said it would be `` a very bad idea '' and he asked the government to call it in for a public inquiry , which would take it out of the hands of the lake district national park authority .
former labour minister lord clark of windermere said it would be `` inappropriate for the tourist industry to see it as merely a way to create another disneyland '' .
the minister , lord bourne , said he could no comment on a live application , although he said the ministry of defence had objected .

documents.title: shaun on track for crewe return
text: carlisle united forward shaun miller has rejoined his former club crewe alexandra on-loan until the end of the season .
the 30-year-old has failed to hold down a regular starting place under keith curle this season despite scoring six times in his 32 appearances .
meanwhile , it 's understood curle is in advanced talks with a forward today with the hope of completing a deal for the player in time for the weekend .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: see how your secondary school is doing
text: see how your secondary school is doing
author: Hannah Richardson
BBC News education reporter

documents.title: alston group moots plan for charging e-cars on street
text: the group in alston that founded the cybermoor broadband network is investigating whether a network of charging points could be set up for people who have no parking close enough to home to power-up electric cars from their own house .
the charging points would be operated with a mobile telephone app , allowing subscribers to pay for a set amount of electricity .
the project will be started on a county-wide scale later this year , but a survey towards a pilot is currently being held in alston .

documents.title: three shops fined after covert teen drink-sales check
text: three shops in north cumbria have been fined for selling alcohol to teenagers after police carried out test purchases in a covert operation .
fixed penalty tickets were given to staff at spar stores in brampton and longtown , and the fourways store in carlisle .
police say local people said they were worried about the levels of underage drinking .

documents.title: travel : roads works cause long delays on a590 and a6
text: there are long delays on the a590 around backbarrow , where there are temporary traffic lights for road works .
there is also congestion on the a6 coming out of kendal because of gas main work near the station .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: miller re-joins crewe from carlisle
text: miller re-joins crewe from carlisle

documents.title: cumbria rally team back on road to defend title
text: the cumbria-based m-sport team get their world rally championship title defence under way today at the season-opening monte carlo rally .

sebastien ogier will be defending the driver 's title he won for malcolm wilson 's team in 2018 , while team-mate elfyn evans will be looking to continue where he left off at the end of 2017 with his first wrc victory at the wales rally gb .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: search starts for right rocks to bury nuclear waste
text: a new search for the right site for a £ 12bn underground nuclear waste store has started again today .
the previous project was abandoned after cumbria county council withdrew its support in 2013 .
currently low-level waste is held on 30 sites around britain , like drigg , near sellafield , while more radioactive materials are stored at the west cumbrian plant .

ministers say there ' will be more effort to involve communities this time , with £ 1m for local programmes to develop works skills and apprenticeships a year provided while a site is explored , and a referendum being possible as part of the process .
once a site is found with the right geology and local support , developing the store 200m ( 650ft ) underground would take between 15 and 20 years , and it would then be used for 100 years .

documents.title: dalton zoo founder says future 'now secure '
text: the man who founded the south lakes safari zoo says its long-term future is now secured after signing a new lease with its new management team .
the new managers took over after a series of highly critical reports ended with the zoo effectively nearly being closed down .
today the chief executive , karen brewer , published a 52-point list of progress since the takeover , including a report by inspectors .
david gill still retains ownership of the dalton-in-furness animal park , but said he was currently working in peru on conservation projects
author: Jennie Dennett
BBC Cumbria

documents.title: council brings contracted-out work back in to cut costs
text: `` significant savings '' will be made by bringing some services back in house , according to barrow council officials .
twenty years ago barrow council first outsourced handling council tax bills , and the contractor , liberata uk , even later set up a large office in barrow to run this and other council contracts .
but now the council , which is cutting £ 2.75m a year from its spending , on top of £ 5m already saved since 2010 , will bring these services back in house from october .
officials say it will give better public access and save money .
the staff involved will transfer over to the council payroll .
author: Neil Smith
South Cumbria journalist, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : blustery showers , turning colder
text: this afternoon will see mixture of sunshine and blustery showers , the showers sometimes merging to bring longer spells of rain , hill snow , and hail in heavier downpours , especially towards keswick and windermere .
it will turn colder later , with maximum temperatures reaching about 7c ( 45f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: the 180 men who never came home
text: most towns remember their war dead on one or two days a year .
this year , in dalton , they will mark the anniversary of every death , day by day .

documents.title: mp seeks meeting with tissue firm over jobs blow
text: the labour mp for barrow and furness , john woodcock , is asking for an urgent meeting with the global tissue maker kimberly clark over its threat to close factories .
the company has not said which of its 10 sites it wants to close , but there 's concern among the 380 people who are employed at the barrow factory .

documents.title: inspectors find little improvement in mental health trust
text: the trust that provides mental health care and a number of other services in cumbria has failed to improve in any of five key areas since its last inspection by the care quality commission .
the watchdog 's latest inspection rates the cumbria partnership trust as requiring improvement in all areas but one , the same result it achieved two years ago .
the trust was praised for having staff with a commitment to good patient care , but pulled up again under headings such as not ensuring that all patient records are up to date .

documents.title: travel : gas mains work causes kendal congestion
text: there are some lengthy delays on shap road in kendal because of gas mains work near the station .
it 's expected to continue until 29 january .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: village plans for new hall , 99 years on
text: there are at least three places in cumbria called stainton , and the one near penrith is preparing to knock down its village hall and built a new one .
the current building , thought to be an old army hut , dates back to 1919 and is showing its age .
the village hall committee hopes to have the new building open in the autumn .
we will still have a main hall , but we 'll have a new purpose-built entrance with a lobby , a kitchen , a meeting room and toilets , so vastly different from where we are today . ''
author: Sian Hall
BBC Radio Cumbria

documents.title: order , order : cumbrian farmer peter speaks to speaker
text: cumbria day , when business people from the county take over a room at the houses of parliament to promote the county 's food and other products , has become a regular fixture at westminster

the county 's online business magazine caught speaker john bercow meeting peter gott , who breeds pigs and wild boar near kendal and sells the results at borough market , just along the river from the commons .
a man of his word .
the speaker of the house if commons john bercow @ twitterid has popped along to # cumbriaday
is he speaking to peter gott from sillifield farm ?
wow !
interesting make a good oil painting for future generations .

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : winter returns
text: the fell top assessors who compile the lake district weatherline report say the thaw yesterday put the becks in spate , but full winter clothing and equipment , including ice axes and crampons , are still essential .

documents.title: farmers warn river fees jump may stop flood work
text: farmers are warning that vital flood defence work might not go ahead because of a jump in the price of the permits .
the environment agency checks the need for work on river beds and banks and wants to increase the cost of the permits that are needed before work is carried out .
the agency has been consulting since just before christmas on the increases in fees , which it says in some cases have not increased in 25 years .
farmers and environmental groups say the increase could stop them carrying out essential work .
a simple task to stop a bank flooding away that would have cost £ 50 in the past is now going to cost £ 764 , and £ 84 an hour for them to check that you 've done it properly .
it 's just outrageous . ''
we wo n't be able to get more money to cover the cost of those permits , so it will just mean the amount of money we have does n't go as far . ''

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : sunshine and blustery showers
text: there should be a mixture of sunshine and blustery showers , these sometimes merging to bring longer spells of rain , hill snow , and hail in heavier downpours .
temperatures could reach about 7c ( 45f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: we 'll be posting news , travel , sport and a regular weather forecast through the day .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: landlady 's fears at 'neo-nazi pub plot '
text: landlady 's fears at 'neo-nazi pub plot '

documents.title: bronze age gold hoard declared treasure
text: bronze age gold hoard declared treasure

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: it 's been a busy news day across cumbria .
we 'll be back to do it again from 08:00 tomorrow , but any major breaking news and travel reports involving the county will appear automatically through the night .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you canemail them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid orhead to our facebook page .

documents.title: police appeal over missing man
text: a carlisle man has gone missing .
martin nicholson , 35 , was last seen in blackwell place at 18:30 on monday .
he is white , 6ft 4in , stocky with short blonde hair .
police are appealing for anyone with information on his whereabouts to get in touch by calling 101 .

documents.title: firms set to move into new estate
text: companies could be moving into new workshops on to a workington industrial estate by the end of next year , according to a cumbrian council .
allerdale council says it 's been successful in a bid for european funding to build 10 modern units in the town at a cost of £ 2.5m
the authority says it will contribute £ 1m towards the development and that work will start later this year .
author: BBC Cumbria

documents.title: charity to help prevent child sexual abuse contacted by nearly 200 people
text: a charity says nearly 200 people in cumbria have come to it for help last year - because of their temptation to view indecent images of children or because they 're concerned about a family member .
the lucy faithfull foundation is starting a campaign with police forces in the north west today to tackle what it says is a `` growing demand '' for sexual images of children on the internet .
cumbria has a dedicated unit that focuses on investigating online child sexual abuse , with many offences involving graphic images of children .
cumbria police says that right now it 's investigating 16 separate cases where arrests have been made and is following leads in 23 potential cases .

documents.title: cumbria 's produce to be showcased at houses of parliament
text: it 's cumbria day again at the houses of parliament .
it 's the fifth year the event has been held and hosted by all six of the county 's mps .
the aim is to showcase the products made here - and a range of companies will attend , including the cranstons butchers , the dent brewery , nestle and the thornby moor dairy .

documents.title: weather : sunny spells and blustery showers this afternoon
text: this afternoon will see a mixture of sunny spells and scattered showers across cumbria .
the showers may turn heavy at times , with the risk of the odd rumble of thunder .
winds remaining strong , but tending to ease a little later .
highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
you can get a detailed weather forecast for where you live here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: labour mp calls for public inquiry into poppi death
text: labour barrow and furness mp john woodcock was at prime minister 's questions and again raised the case of poppi worthington , who died in 2012 aged 13 months .
he says she was not known to social services `` despite a staggeringly troubled personal history '' and calls for a public inquiry into the case .
theresa may says the case will have `` shocked and appalled everybody '' and the crown prosecution service is considering the case further .
she urges everyone to wait for the outcome of that process .
prosecutors are considering the findings of a fresh inquest into the death of the toddler after the coroner ruled she was sexually assaulted by her father .

documents.title: bronze age jewellery find declared treasure
text: bronze age jewellery dug up in funess last year has been declared treasure - opening the way for it to be acquired for display in barrow 's dock museum .
an inquest heard that the 3,000-year-old rings and bracelet found near urswick were rewriting the understanding of the settlement which was there at about 1000bc .
two metal detectorists , john rigg and darren fine , found the jewellery buried under a stone on a ridge at an undisclosed site in urswick parish .
coroner paul o'donnell said it was `` near '' the stone circle .
he found the items met the requirements of the treasure act and will be valued next month , after which the dock museum hopes to acquire them .
such finds are rare and the coroner said it has prompted new academic inquiries about bronze age settlements this far north west .
author: Neil Smith
South Cumbria journalist, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: your photos : a very full derwentwater
text: thanks to our bbc weather watcher 'michael 's meadow ' for these photos taken this morning of a very full derwentwater .
if you 'd like to become a bbc weather watcher you can sign up here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: some 20,000 children in cumbria are growing up in poverty
text: twenty-thousand cumbrian children are growing up in poverty , according to new figures from the end child poverty coalition .
it says parts of whitehaven and barrow have rates of child poverty that are almost as high as the national peaks .
sandwith ward in whitehaven , containing the woodhouse and greenbank estates , has overtaken central in barrow to have the worst rate .
in both , getting on for one in every two children is living below the breadline .
the end child poverty coalition is blaming the government 's policy of maintaining the benefits freeze despite rising prices .
copeland council is promising to prioritise tackling the issue .
author: Neil Smith
South Cumbria journalist, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: weather : today 's fells forecast
text: if you 're thinking of heading out on to the fells , here 's the forecast :
for further information about the conditions you can see the lake district weatherline report here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: will bronze age jewellery found in barrow field be declared treasure ?
text: an inquest in barrow today will decide whether bronze age gold jewellery found in a furness field should be declared treasure .
the two rings and a bracelet are thought to be about 3,000 years old .
the dock museum in barrow is waiting for a valuation to see whether it can afford to add them to its growing collection of ancient finds .
author: Neil Smith
South Cumbria journalist, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: uncertainty in barrow as kimberley-clark announces plans to cut 5,000 jobs
text: the leader of barrow council , dave pidduck , says the announcement from kimberley-clark that it is cutting jobs has come as a `` bolt from the blue '' .
three-hundred-and-eighty people work at the factory in barrow , which makes andrex toilet tissue and huggies nappies .
the company has said it will close or sell 10 manufacturing plants and cut at least 5,000 jobs - about 12 % of its workforce .
it 's not yet yet known where the jobs will go .

documents.title: photo : fallen tree blocks road
text: i came across this fallen tree on a minor road near newby east , near carlisle , this morning :
author: Mark McAlindon
BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : a wet and windy start , then brighter with showers
text: a wet and windy start to wednesday as a band of occasionally heavy rain , accompanied by gusty and squally winds , moves quickly southeastwards .
the rain will clear by mid-morning , giving way to sunny spells and then some heavy showers , but it will remain windy .
highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
you can get a detailed weather forecast for where you live here .

documents.title: wiggonby c of e school closed
text: wiggonby c of e school , near wigton , is closed today because they have no electricity .

documents.title: who will you be signing up ? # fapeoplescup
text: with big rewards on offer ( the chance to play at st george 's park and go to the fa cup final ) , it 's also going to be an interesting time in the five-a-side transfer market in the coming few weeks !
it 's time to get your team together for the 2018 fa people 's cup - the free five-a-side tournament that 's back and even bigger than before .
but do n't leave it too long - you might miss a good deal .
sign up here .

documents.title: trees down and roads closed after high winds hit county
text: cumbria has been hit by strong winds overnight .
here 's how it 's affected the county :
scaffolding screens have been blown over on castle street in carlisle :
and a tree blocked the road at causeway head , near silloth :
we are currently dealing with a tree down at causeway head just after the bend .
please slow down numerous near collisions already occurred .
highways aware & on route .
# keepingyousafe # ruralpolicing

documents.title: police warn drivers to 'be vigilant '
text: cumbria police have warned drivers in the north and west of cumbria to 'be vigilant ' this morning because of the strong winds :
be vigilant on your journey .
extremely strong winds & we 've already had several calls regarding trees in carriageways in the west & north of cumbria .
# drivesafe

documents.title: travel : a66 closed in both directions between scotch corner and brough
text: the a66 is closed in both directions between scotch corner and brough because of an overturned lorry at old spittal .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: good morning .
what a blustery start to the day .
we 'll be posting news , travel , sport and a regular weather forecast through the day .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
author: Nell Dunn
BBC Cumbria

documents.title: neo-nazi 'planned gay night murders '
text: neo-nazi 'planned gay night murders '

documents.title: preparing for take-off : bbc cumbria live
text: it 's been a busy news day across cumbria - here 's a reminder of some of the main developments .
we 'll be back to do it again from 08:00 tomorrow , but any major breaking news and travel reports involving the county will appear automatically through the night .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: airport aims for 50,000 passengers in first year
text: stobart group , the company behind the plans for carlisle airport , says it 's in talks with a number of airlines as it starts to develop commercial services from this summer .
almost £ 5m is being invested in the runway and terminal facilities to start services to stobart 's airport in southend for london , and also belfast and dublin , on 4 june .

kate willard , head of corporate projects at the stobart group , which has its own small airline working with aer lingus and flybe , says she hopes the carlisle lake district airport , as it will be known , will cater for 50,000 passengers in the first year .

it 's not that we 're short of airlines , we 're actually talking to a couple , it 's making sure we choose the right one , and i 'm going to be really excited to announce that in the next couple of weeks , at which point people can start booking tickets . ''

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : rain and gales crossing county
text: there 'll be a dry start to the night across cumbria with clear spells , but winds will strengthen with rain arriving by midnight , heavy enough to prompt a yellow warning for part of the county .
this will turn heavy and squally for a time , with gales in exposed parts , and it will turn cooler later with temperatures falling towards 6c ( 43f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: specialist school given second 'outstanding ' rating
text: a north cumbrian school which specialises in teaching children with various additional needs has been graded outstanding by inspectors for the second time in four years .
kirby moor , the inspectors say turns round the lives of pupils `` when no one else and nowhere else can '' .
the school has 35 students , about half of whom are in care , from across a wide area of cumbria and northumberland .
they face a variety of social , emotional , mental health and other needs .
the report should be here shortly .
teachers help pupils find their zest for learning . ''

documents.title: community meetings planned to show flood control options
text: environment agency officials are planning a series of meetings across cumbria to explain what the options are to improve flood defences after storm desmond .
the government has made up to £ 72m available and andy brown , the flood risk manager , says they are gradually refining the list of possible projects .
the projects , and the meetings , are grouped by catchment areas , covering the eden , the derwent , and the kent and leven areas in south cumbria .
the agency says it wants to make sure the projects are based on strong science and local knowledge .
you can read about the overall plan here .
at this stage no decisions have been made - nothing is set in stone .
our aim is to develop and deliver flood risk options that are justified and acceptable to all interested and affected parties . ''

documents.title: barrow 'nazi ' a white fantasist , defence barrister tells court
text: the barrister defending a barrow man accused of planning a terrorist attack on a gay pride event at a pub on the town has described his client as a `` white fantasist '' , rather that a white supremacist .
ethan stables , 20 , of egerton court in barrow , denies preparing a terrorist act and making threats to kill .

this morning , prosecution barrister jonathan sandiford described how mr stables , a `` white supremacist and nazi '' , was arrested as he reconnoitered the new empire pub , having told friends on a facebook page that he would attack people there with a machete .

in his statement to the jury , patrick upward qc , defending , agreed the material outlined by the prosecution was an `` awful , disgusting , vile series of posts '' , but he said : `` he never expected anyone to believe what he had to say . ''
the trial continues .

documents.title: zip wire controversy to go before planners in march
text: lake district planners will decide their view on the controversial scheme for zip wires across thirlmere in the lake district in march .

the national park authority said today it had received 3,476 emails and letters expressing concern and opposition , and 163 in support of the proposal for two sets of four zipwires , one in each direction , crossing the lake
the planners say they will no consider everything that 's been said and report to a meeting on 7 march .
that report will be made public on 27 february .
the developers , treetop trek , will have the right to appeal against the decision at that meeting , if it goes against the scheme .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: cumbria police react to workington rape verdicts
text: cumbria police have published a statement after four boys , all under 16 , were cleared by a carlisle crown court jury of charges of rape and sexual assault .

whilst the defendants have been acquitted today , cumbria constabulary would like to assure the public that it takes accusations of sexual offences extremely seriously and we will continue to investigate any such accusations which are made , whatever the circumstances , thoroughly and professionally . ''

documents.title: judge thanks jury in workington rape case
text: there were tears in carlisle crown court this afternoon as four boys were cleared of raping and sexually assaulting a 15-year-old girl in a field in workington .
some of the boys , and the adults with them , wept as the jury foreman delivered the verdicts after five-and-a half hours of deliberations .
judge james adkins said : `` the defendants can be discharged .
if you would like to leave the court quietly now please . ''
he told the jury : `` thank you very much for your careful consideration of the circumstances of this difficult case . ''

documents.title: heavy rain warning posted for cumbria
text: the met office has posted a yellow warning of heavy rain for the small hours of tomorrow morning for the eastern part of cumbria .
up to 50mm of rain is expected in areas like the top of the tyne valley , with lesser amounts in the eden valley and down along the pennines .

documents.title: boys not guilty of raping girl , 15 ,
text: boys not guilty of raping girl , 15 ,

documents.title: mouse shares lynne 's on the fell
text: this hungry mouse proved an extra attraction for one fell walker at the weekend .
the little creature came begging as lynne hardie settled down for a sandwich on great rigg , which is part of the fairfield horseshoe north of ambleside .
`` it actually ran over to me , seeking food '' , said lynne on twitter .
`` what a sweetie , it must have been very hungry . ''
it made my fabulous solo fell walk in the snow even more special ! ''
great rigg sat 20th jan well , this is a first !
never had a woodmouse come begging for my sandwhiches on the fells before !
it actually ran over to me , seeking food what a sweetie , it must have been very hungry it made my fabulous solo fell walk in the snow even more special !
the woodmouse actually climbed up the rock to me and sat face to face with me , and put it 's little nose in air 'asking ' for food .
i gave the woodmouse a bread crust to eat , as you can see in my photo , and put some extra crusts underneath a rock for it to eat later .
magical !
hi lynne .
it 's reading things like that , that makes my day
hi june , thanks for your lovely comment glad i made your day with my photo and story : - ) > : d <
sorry , i spelt your name wrong jude predictive text !
no worries lynne - thanks for your lovely comments about my photos , which are much appreciated : - )
aaaaw , i hope you saved its little life
i m sure i did thanks : - )
so happy to see he put his trust in the right person !
thanks be it was an honour that the woodmouse trusted me and it got a yummy reward that kept it going : - )
been fed before !
probably very hungry no food to be found for it in the very deep snow : - )
i think we might have met the same mouse !
this one climbed onto my girlfriend 's boot on gowbarrow fell
that 's a great photo it would be a well travelled mouse to make it to great rigg , lol ! !
haha , he did seem quite worldly to me !
that is awesome .
thank you mary : - )
lovely photo .
must have been hungry !
think he was to do that : - )
sometimes you need to be brave to get a reward !
the woodmouse was certainly brave , and we both got our rewards !

documents.title: new inspector recruits 'will learn the job on beat '
text: representatives of rank and file police officers say they 've helped draw up the training scheme for a new direct entry scheme that will see inspectors recruited directly , rather than working their way up from constable .

the cumbria force is about to recruit its first officer under the system , and has acknowledged there might be some scepticism about bringing in people with strong management skills but not the direct experience of policing on the street

insp lee skelton , who has years of experience policing events such as appleby horse fair and is a former police federation representative for the county , says that it depends on recruiting the right person with the right skills .

we 've managed to influence the programme and i think we 're reassured to a degree that 80 % of the training will be on the job , at pc , sergeant and inspector rank , working alongside experienced officers . ''

documents.title: breakingboys not guilty of workington rape charges
text: four boys have been found not guilty of raping a 15-year-old girl in workington .
during a two week trial , the four had insisted the girl had asked them whether they wanted sex and consented to what took place in a field in january last year .
the jury found each of the boys , who can not be named , not guilty of two charges of rape and one of sexual assault .

documents.title: police seek woman who has missed four court dates
text: cumbria police are looking for 30-year-old lauren slater , who is wanted for failing to appear at court on four occasions for theft-related offences .
she is described as of medium build and about 5ft 6in .
she has connections with kendal , windermere and morecambe .

documents.title: number of dogs stolen in cumbria rockets in three years
text: the number of dogs stolen in cumbria is rocketing - as thieves target popular pet breeds that can be sold for hundreds of pounds as well as valuable working dogs .
author: North West Evening Mail

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : brighter , but with showers
text: it will gradually become brighter , with further showers , occasionally heavy with the risk of thunder at times .
there will be strong winds , with gales in places , but a milder feel , with highs today of about 12c ( 54f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: barrow 'nazi ' planned murderous attack , court told
text: a barrow man described as being a white supremacist with a hatred of black people , muslims , jewish people and especially gay people '' has gone on trial in leeds accused of a number of charges including preparing terrorist acts .

ethan stables , 20 , who denies all the charges against him , told other members of a far-right group on social media that he planned to attack a gay pride night at the new empire pub ( in the town with a machete .
opening the trial at leeds crown court , prosecutor jonathan sandiford told the jury that the defendant was `` a white supremacist , a neo-nazi who supported adolf hitler '' .
`` he was planning acts of terrorism against members of these groups .
his intention was to launch a murderous attack on members of these communities . ''
police were tipped off and arrested mr stables as he reconnoitered the pub before going home to collect his weapons , mr sandiford said .
at his home they found a machete , an explosive substance , and nazi regalia , the court heard .
author: Dominic Casciani
Home Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: date for airport to resume passenger flights
text: date for airport to resume passenger flights

documents.title: police insist : most inspectors will still rise from ranks
text: police officers in cumbria are being reassured that a plan to recruit an inspector who has n't come up through the ranks will not affect the prospects of promotion for those who do .

cumbria 's constabulary is taking its first step into a scheme called direct entry , offering the chance to become an inspector to candidates with a proven track record of leadership and management skills .

supt sarah jackson says the successful candidate would be required to go through a two-year training programme including time on the beat and in operational roles , and the vast majority of new inspectors would still be promoted into the role from the ranks

there will be a degree of scepticism , however , but this is one role in about 60 police inspector roles that we already have in the organisation and over the past 12 months we 've run our inspector promotion process twice . ''

documents.title: travel : tree felling slows traffic on a590
text: traffic is very slow on the a590 near backbarrow , where temporary traffic lights have been set up while trees are cut back .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: fire service deals with four chimney blazes in four days
text: cumbria 's fire and rescue service says it has dealt with four chimney fires since friday evening .
the latest , last night , was in cumrew , near carlisle , with two more in cleator and carlisle yesterday and one in kendal on friday evening .

documents.title: four county mps call for poppi worthington inquiry
text: four of cumbria 's mps now say there should be a public inquiry into the death of the barrow toddler poppi worthington .

she died in 2012 , and last week , cumbria 's senior coroner ruled that the 13-month-old was probably sexually abused by her father , paul worthington before she died from asphyxia while sharing a bed with him .
he denies assaulting his daughter and has never been charged .
the labour mp for barrow and furness john woodcock , has sent a letter to the prime minister saying a public inquiry is necessary .
it has been signed by the liberal democrat mp tim farron , labour 's workington mp sue hayman and the conservative mp for copeland trudy harrison .

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : thawing at all levels
text: the lake district weatherline report says there 's a thaw at all levels , with snow very wet and cornices unstable ; full winter equipment , including crampons , ice axe and goggles are essential , along with excellent navigational skills .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : mild , cloudy and blustery
text: it will be a cloudy and fairly blustery morning with outbreaks of rain , some turning heavy , especially across the fells .
it 'll be milder again , with temperatures up to about 12c ( 54f . )
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: breakingstobart confirms carlisle flights to start in june
text: the first passengers will fly in and out of carlisle lake district airport on 4 june , the company that owns it , stobart group , is announcing today .
more details will be announced later , but the aim is to link the county with hubs in london , dublin and belfast .

cumbria 's local enterprise partnership has committed £ 4.95m to develop the airport , with the aim of increasing international tourism directly into the lake district rather than through traditional routes via london .

documents.title: travel : roadworks on m6 near carlisle and a592
text: it is worth a reminder that the a592 up the east side of windermere from newby bridge to bowness is still closed in both directions between ghyll head road and lakeside , for sewer works .
and if you are heading into scotland on the m6 there is a lane closure for resurfacing between junction 44 and junction 45 .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: good morning : we 'll be posting news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and the odd extra nugget that catches our eye , through to about 18:00 .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: there 's been a variety of news about today , as the first thaw of the winter arrived : here 's a reminder :
we 'll be back to do it all again from 08:00 tomorrow , but this page will continue to automatically update with any breaking news or travel .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : wind rising and rain moving in
text: cloud will thicken from the west with outbreaks of rain by dawn as the winds freshen , possibly touching gale force along the cumbrian coast later , and temperatures falling to 4c ( 39f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: brothers jailed for trying to fence stolen gates
text: police were waiting when two brothers from northamptonshire arrived at an auction in carlisle hoping to sell £ 30,000 worth of equipment , a court has heard .
carlisle crown court was told expensive agricultural machinery and gates had been stolen from farms , and auction house staff had become sus
william andrew fury , 31 , of knox road , wellingborough , and 27-year-old joseph fury , of jubilee drive , walgrave , admitted conspiracy to to handle stolen goods .
william was jailed for 12 months and jospeh for nine , for what recorder david potter said was `` a significant conspiracy to handle stolen goods of high value '' .

documents.title: curle still hopes to strengthen squad to make play-offs
text: carlisle united manager keith curle says he is still trying to attract the right new recruit to the club to boost the blues ' chances of making the league two play-offs .

with time running out in the january transfer window , and united nine points adrift of the play-off places , he says clubs like forest green and chesterfield have more money and are buying more players , but he is more ambitious .
we 're still competing with those clubs , they 've got more money to spend then i have , they 're desperate to stay in the league , we 're desperate to get into the play-offs . ''
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: new school will teach 'for mental wellbeing '
text: a new primary school is being planned for carlisle , with an emphasis on mental wellbeing .
holme head house in denton holme will take 30 children , aged between three and 11 .
the people who will run it say it will focus on family life , and have its own curriculum .
ali pate , one of the founders , says the children will be encouraged to follow their interests .
it 's about following their interests and their passions and there 's no limit to what they could learn . ''
the school will rely on crowd-funding from local people and businesses to raise funds , and says it will need about £ 100,000 .
john cole , from the national association of primary education , says that may not be enough

you need more than £ 5,000 a year these days per child , so if they have 60 pupils they 're going to need £ 300,000 a year and at the moment there 's no indication who is going to fund this school . ''
author: Sian Hall
BBC Radio Cumbria

documents.title: a grand day out : walkers line up for the edge
text: the lake district rangers who ascend helvellyn daily through the winter often stress the need for ice axes and crampons .
but given the right kit and the right weather , for many people a covering of snow and ice is the recipe for a grand day out .

on saturday , there was almost a queue of walkers along striding edge , one of the most challenging approaches to helvellyn , and jon bennett , the duty assessor , took this ( showing the nearest walker , as you would expect , wearing crampons and carrying an ice axe ) .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: jury out in workington 'schoolboy rape ' trial
text: the jury in the trial of four schoolboys accused of raping a 15-year-old girl has started considering its verdict .
the four are all charged with two counts of rape and one of sexual assault over the alleged attack in a field in workington last january .
the boys , who are all from west cumbria , claim the girl consented to sex .
but the prosecution says the boys took turns to rape the girl in a `` brutal sexual attack '' .

documents.title: inquest told of woman who died after breathing tube error
text: an inquest has resumed into the death of a cumbrian woman who died from lack of oxygen to her brain after routine surgery at the cumberland infirmary in carlisle .
sharon grierson from aspatria died in november 2016 when complications arose after the removal of a tube that was helping her to breathe .
doctors then wrongly reinserted the tube twice as she went into cardiac arrest .
today a doctor who reviewed the incident said medics were trying to do the right thing , but discounted evidence from a machine that suggested mrs grierson 's oxygen levels had fallen .
the hearing continues .

documents.title: twitter , a cumbrian mp , and his tipple of choice
text: the westmorland and lonsdale mp tim farron has found his used to illustrate a story in australia on the dangers of drinking high-energy drinks .
a members of the lib dem mp 's staff said : `` we 've no idea where it came from .
`` any publicity is good publicity . ''
to be honest it 's just nice to have a of me on social media with a drink that is n't milk
do n't get too comfortable
i feel i need to apologise to you , tim .
what 's in the cup tim ? ? ? ? ? ? ?
gay frog puree
risky game chowing down on gay frog puree i heard the gay can be infectious
especially now they 've put chemicals in the water too
milk is n't a drink , it 's an ingredient .
you are officially the face of `` young people '' according to @ twitterid australia
@ twitterid stick with the milk it will do you more good # proudofdairy
cow breastmilk yuk .
was the side effect homophobia ?
@ twitterid feel like you 'll appreciate this

documents.title: police seek passenger who damaged bus
text: police have released this cctv image as they investigate an incident in which a man boarding a bus in carlisle abused the driver and damaged the vehicle .
the incident happened last thursday .

documents.title: final stage of huge walney wind farm starts making power
text: the first electricity is being generated from the final stage of the walney extension offshore windfarm , which once it is completed later this year will be the largest in the world .
the first three of 47 siemens gamesa 7mw turbines have been installed , the first time they 've been used , and once the whole project is complete , it could produce enough power for 500,000 homes .
the turbines are loaded in huge components onto a barge and carried out to be assembled offshore .
once assembled , they stand between 190m ( 623ft ) and 222m ( 728ft ) tall , and when the windfarm is complete later this year , it will be the largest in the world .

documents.title: national park gets tolkien-style map
text: national park gets tolkien-style map

documents.title: banners will mark 100 years since women got the vote
text: eleven banners have been unveiled at keswick museum today to celebrate women in cumbria .
they have been designed by women and girls as part of a year-long programme to mark 100 years since some women were first allowed to vote .
the banners will be displayed in museums across cumbria after their unveiling .

documents.title: drugs arrest after man 's body found
text: drugs arrest after man 's body found

documents.title: nursery school closes after heating fails
text: bram longstaffe nursery school in barrow is closed until tomorrow because the heating has failed .

documents.title: police open new scheme to recruit senior officers direct
text: cumbria police is taking its first steps into recruiting future senior officers directly into the rank of inspector .
until now officers have always risen through the ranks , joining as constables and working their way up .
supt sarah jackson said : `` it 's a chance for someone who has already proven themselves as a manager to start a second career . ''
the cumbria force is currently aiming to recruit just one inspector .
the programme has been running for up to five years in other forces , some of which have also recruited superintendents directly .

documents.title: cumbria 's 'lone trees ' photographed
text: cumbria 's 'lone trees ' photographed

documents.title: minister quizzed over stopping lakes line electrification
text: the transport minister chris grayling is being questioned by mps today over the decision to scrap a number of rail electrification projects , including the lakes line between oxenholme , on the west coast main line , and windermere .
mr grayling said that modern technology would allow so-called bi-modal trains , which could switch between electricity and diesel .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : feeling much less cold
text: it will remain mostly cloudy but some bright spells are also likely .
feeling much less cold than recent days .
the highest temperatures will be up to 8c ( 46f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cumbria worst hit for cash-strapped schools
text: more schools are struggling to balance their books under increasing levels of debt in cumbria than any other part of the country .
author: North West Evening Mail

documents.title: moore and yussuf leave barrow
text: moore and yussuf leave barrow

documents.title: mp rory suggests £ 5 on council tax for 'flood fund '
text: cumbria 's taxpayers should pay a little more more council tax to contribute to a flood fund .
the conservative mp for penrith and the border , rory stewart , says this is already done in other parts of the country , such as somerset , to raise more money for flood defences .

in the lyth valley in cumbria , and on the solway mosses , there are long-running proposals for drainage boards to maintain pumps and dykes , that would be funded by an extra levy on the council tax , but these have so far come to nothing .

a £ 5 levy on the council tax if we took 100,000 council tax payers , could bring in £ 500,000 a year , and if you put that into a fund managed by the county council you could have , over five years £ 2.5m .

documents.title: sellafield firefighters walk out over pay
text: sellafield firefighters walk out over pay

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : still freezing on the summits
text: the lake district weatherline rangers went for a lower summit again yesterday because the conditions were so poor on the fell tops , but they say there were deep snow drifts at all levels .
they say the milder weather should consolidate unstable snow , but full winter clothing and equipment are still required .

documents.title: nuclear plant fire crews on strike again
text: firefighters at sellafield are taking industrial action again today in a long-running dispute over pay .
members of the gmb union will be on strike until 18:00 : officials say the two sides are not far apart but the company 's latest offer still fell short .
a spokesman for the nuclear site says full emergency safety cover will be in place during the stoppages .

documents.title: stevenage 0-0 carlisle united
text: stevenage 0-0 carlisle united

documents.title: police investigate death in barrow
text: the police are investigating the death of a 41-year-old man in barrow in the early hours of sunday .
barrow cid officers began the investigation after paramedics called to a ground floor flat in broad close found the man , who has not yet been formally identified .
a woman has been arrested on sus of supplying drugs and released while investigations continue .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : mostly dry and milder
text: it will eventually be a dry day for most and milder than recently , though there is still a risk of ice on untreated surfaces across eastern parts at first .
there is a chance of a few light showers , gentle westerly winds and a maximum temperature of 8c ( 46f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : winter still affecting higher roads
text: the snow and ice has still to be cleared from the county 's higher roads : police say the a686 hartside pass is still closed because of snow , along with the cold fell road and hardknott pass in the west of the county .
elsewhere , police say there may be longer delays on the a596 from egremont because of industrial action by fire crews at sellafield .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: welcome to monday : this is bbc cumbria live
text: good morning : we 'll be posting news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and the other odd nugget , through until 18:00 .
if you 've got a story , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
